name: Classic Cold Brew
steps: Combine coffee grounds and cold water in a large jar or pitcher.
Stir gently to ensure all grounds are saturated.
Cover and refrigerate for 12-18 hours.
Strain through a fine mesh sieve lined with cheesecloth.
Serve over ice, diluting with water or milk to taste.
description: A smooth, low-acid coffee steeped overnight for a naturally sweet and bold flavor.

name: Vanilla Sweet Cold Brew
steps: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour vanilla syrup over the ice.
Add cold brew concentrate.
Top with milk and stir gently to combine.
description: A creamy, vanilla-kissed cold brew that's refreshing and indulgent.

name: Cold Brew Concentrate
steps: Combine coffee grounds and water in a large jar at a 1:4 ratio.
Stir well and seal the jar tightly.
Refrigerate for 18-24 hours for maximum extraction.
Strain twice through a fine sieve and cheesecloth.
Store concentrate in the fridge; dilute 1:1 with water or milk to serve.
description: An extra-strong concentrate perfect for diluting into your ideal cold brew strength.

name: Decaf Cold Brew
steps: Combine decaf coffee grounds and cold water in a large jar.
Stir to ensure all grounds are evenly saturated.
Cover and refrigerate for 12-18 hours.
Strain through a cheesecloth-lined sieve.
Serve over ice with a splash of milk if desired.
description: All the smooth, mellow flavor of cold brew without the caffeine buzz.

name: Classic Pour Over
steps: Place the paper filter in the dripper and rinse with hot water; discard rinse water.
Add coffee grounds and create a small well in the center.
Pour 40ml of water to bloom the grounds; wait 30 seconds.
Slowly pour remaining water in concentric circles over 2-3 minutes.
Let the last of the water drain through and serve immediately.
description: A clean, bright cup that highlights the origin character of your beans.

name: Honey Pour Over
steps: Drizzle honey into the bottom of your serving mug.
Rinse the paper filter with hot water and discard rinse water.
Add grounds, bloom with 40ml water for 30 seconds.
Pour remaining water in slow, steady circles over 2-3 minutes.
Stir the brewed coffee in the mug to dissolve the honey and enjoy.
description: A naturally sweetened pour over with floral honey notes complementing the coffee.

name: Japanese Iced Pour Over
steps: Place 120g of ice in your serving vessel.
Set up the dripper on top and rinse the filter with hot water.
Add coffee grounds and bloom with 45ml water for 30 seconds.
Pour remaining hot water slowly; it will drip directly onto the ice.
Swirl gently to chill and serve immediately.
description: Flash-chilled pour over that locks in bright, complex flavors over ice.

name: Decaf Pour Over
steps: Rinse the paper filter with hot water and discard.
Add decaf grounds and make a small well in the center.
Bloom with 45ml of water for 35 seconds.
Pour remaining water in slow, steady circles.
Let it drain completely and enjoy a calm, clean cup.
description: A mellow, clean-tasting pour over for those quiet caffeine-free moments.

name: Classic Espresso
steps: Grind beans to a fine, powdery consistency.
Distribute grounds evenly in the portafilter and tamp firmly.
Lock the portafilter and start extraction.
Aim for 25-30 seconds of extraction yielding about 36ml.
Serve immediately in a pre-warmed demitasse cup.
description: A concentrated shot of pure coffee with a thick, golden crema on top.

name: Doppio Espresso
steps: Grind beans to a fine espresso grind.
Dose 18g into a double portafilter basket and tamp evenly.
Extract for 25-30 seconds, yielding approximately 60ml.
Check for a rich, tiger-striped crema.
Serve in a warm cappuccino cup for sipping.
description: A bold double shot with intense flavor and a velvety crema layer.

name: Espresso Macchiato
steps: Pull a standard espresso shot (18g in, 36ml out, 25-30 sec).
Steam a small amount of milk until frothy.
Spoon a single dollop of foam onto the espresso.
Serve immediately to enjoy the contrast of bitter and creamy.
description: An espresso 'stained' with just a touch of milk foam for a balanced sip.

name: Classic Espresso Tonic
steps: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour cold tonic water over the ice.
Slowly pour a freshly pulled espresso shot over the back of a spoon to layer.
Garnish with a lemon twist if desired.
Stir gently before drinking or enjoy the layered effect.
description: A fizzy, bittersweet refresher where espresso meets sparkling tonic water.

name: Citrus Espresso Tonic
steps: Fill a glass with ice and add fresh orange juice.
Pour tonic water over the ice and orange juice.
Pull a fresh espresso shot and let it cool for 30 seconds.
Slowly pour the espresso over the back of a spoon to create layers.
Garnish with an orange slice and serve.
description: A vibrant twist on the espresso tonic with fresh citrus brightness.

name: Lavender Espresso Tonic
steps: Add lavender syrup to the bottom of a tall glass.
Fill with ice cubes.
Pour tonic water over the ice and stir gently.
Slowly pour espresso over the back of a spoon to layer.
Garnish with a dried lavender sprig.
description: A floral and fizzy espresso tonic with calming lavender notes.

name: Classic Caffe Latte
steps: Pull a fresh espresso shot into a large mug.
Steam milk until silky with microfoam (60-65°C).
Pour steamed milk slowly into the espresso, holding back foam.
Top with a thin layer of milk foam.
Serve immediately while hot.
description: The quintessential milk coffee — creamy, smooth, and perfectly balanced.

name: Vanilla Latte
steps: Add vanilla syrup to a large mug.
Pull a fresh espresso shot directly into the syrup and stir.
Steam milk to silky microfoam (60-65°C).
Pour steamed milk into the mug in a steady stream.
Optionally dust with vanilla powder on top.
description: A warm, aromatic latte with smooth vanilla sweetness in every sip.

name: Oat Milk Latte
steps: Pull a fresh espresso shot into a large mug.
Steam barista-style oat milk to silky microfoam (65°C).
Pour slowly into the espresso for a smooth blend.
The natural sweetness of oat milk complements the espresso perfectly.
description: A plant-based latte with naturally sweet, creamy oat milk.

name: Decaf Latte
steps: Pull a decaf espresso shot into a large mug.
Steam milk until silky with microfoam (60-65°C).
Pour steamed milk slowly into the espresso.
Top with a thin layer of foam and serve.
description: All the creamy comfort of a latte, completely caffeine-free.

name: Classic Iced Coffee
steps: Brew coffee at double strength using your preferred method.
Allow the coffee to cool to room temperature.
Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour coffee over the ice and add sweetener or milk to taste.
description: A simple, refreshing iced coffee perfect for warm days.

name: Iced Mocha
steps: Add chocolate syrup to a tall glass.
Pour in the espresso or strong coffee and stir to combine.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour cold milk over the ice.
Top with whipped cream if desired.
description: A chocolatey, indulgent iced coffee that satisfies both coffee and dessert cravings.

name: Caramel Iced Coffee
steps: Drizzle caramel sauce along the inside of a tall glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour cooled strong coffee over the ice.
Add cold milk and stir to swirl the caramel through.
description: A buttery caramel iced coffee with beautiful sauce swirls in every glass.

name: Decaf Iced Coffee
steps: Brew decaf coffee at double strength.
Allow to cool to room temperature.
Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour decaf coffee over ice and add milk to taste.
description: A refreshing caffeine-free iced coffee for any time of day.
